intro: Ribes triste var. alaskanum, commonly known as the Alaskan gooseberry, is a shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the genus Ribes, which includes various species of shrubs and vines. The plant is characterized by its small, tart berries that are typically green when unripe and turn red or yellow when mature. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a serrated margin. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas or along streambanks.
